page.title: 11Local History(2)
page.content:
In the 19th century Halifax was one of the biggest{wool and linen producing towns in England.However, tough competition from the East produced cheap material,making British wool look relatively expensive.So, when the imported material started being used,the British woollen industry began to rapidly decline.
{ The Cragg Coiners,}forgers of gold coins, were a gang of men who set up at Bell House with their melting pots,branding irons and equipment necessary for this crime.They clipped the gold coins and melted them,making perfect forgeries.
